_header: Down by the river as I read
Title(s): ‘Do for thy self quhill thov art heir’
_description: ‘Do for thy self quhill thov art heir’, attributed to William Dunbar — ten 8-line stanzas including this refrain

Banna.First Lines:
Doun by ane rever as I redoutthrow a forrest that wes
                    fair…
Banna.Last Lines:
…Thow may say that a fowle the lerdDo for thy self Quhill thow
                    art heir
